timeline.bodyText:
I kind of liked the previous format, although it was not consistent (e.g. was using INFO for module activity).
If you go this direction, then there are 3 occurrences of StartLog.log("COPY", ...) and 1 of StartLog.log("DOWNLD", ...) to replace.
timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText: I'm torn.... but on balance I think that INFO/WARN are least surprise.
replies.author: gregw

timeline.message:
Issue #5256 --add-modules

updates from review

Signed-off-by: Greg Wilkins <gregw@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText: This should be mkdir for consistency with other logs, not create.
timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText: but it is not a directory!  "touch" ?
replies.author: gregw

replies.bodyText: @joakime exectly because the option is now --create-start-ini and --create-startd is a noop
replies.author: gregw

replies.bodyText: Note that --create-start-ini  takes all the files in start.d and concats them into a start.ini and then removes start.d
replies.author: gregw

timeline.bodyText: You used cp in BaseBuilder:205 so I would be consistent - I like better "copy" than "cp".
timeline.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText: "Programmatic ACK" -> "Automatic License Acknowledgment" - these are sysops or beginners, they don't know what "ACK" is.
timeline.author: sbordet
sbordet
